ygData.subject: Re: The thrill of being a bard: was sonorous clounding  message
ygData.msgSnippet: EQ s official verdict on that is that it isnt a bug.. thats what is supposed to happen. I dropped a pack that had a SBS and a PG Tommie.. imagine how happy I
ygData.messageBody:
EQ's official verdict on that is that it isnt a bug.. thats what is supposed
to happen. I dropped a pack that had a SBS and a PG Tommie.. imagine how
happy I was considering how often the stupid guy with the tommie spawns.. I
petitioned and was told to contact verant directly and was given an email
address. I emailed him and he said I am sorry about your loss there is
nothing we will do that is how it is supposed to happen.. Let me tell you
how happy I was..

----- Original Message -----
From: <jhenders@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 3:50 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] The thrill of being a bard: was sonorous clounding
message


> From: jhenders@...
>
> On Tue, Aug 31/99, "Chris Kuenster (Entex)" <v-ntxck@...> wrote:
> > From: "Chris Kuenster (Entex)" <v-ntxck@...>
> >
> > Man that bites considering all the switching we do between weapons and
> > instruments. Well I have dropped Lore like Tomahawks and Claw on the
floor
> > and its always been there to pickup. Its a good thing Verant is so quick
to
> > replace bug-lost items. My best friend a 47th Monk zoned into Sol B 2
weeks
> > ago and arrived totally nekkid, Verant still hasnt replaced his stuff
even
> > though they have promised a complete restore of his charactor.
>
> Damn is that bug still around? That happened to a friend of mine the
> week they advertised Sol B open and populated.
>
>
>
>
